content.question: At <math alttext="298 Kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></math>, <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> readily dissolves in water, suggesting that the change in free energy (<math alttext="delta G" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) favors the dissolution process. However, when <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves in water, the temperature of the water decreases. The particulate diagram above attempts to provide a microscopic view of the dissolution of <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> considering both the change in enthalpy (<math alttext="delta H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) and the change in entropy (<math alttext="delta S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>). Which of the following explains what the particle diagram is able to illustrate and why?

choices.label: The particle diagram is able to illustrate that the <math alttext="delta H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the dissolution of <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is exothermic because overcoming the attractive forces between the ions requires the absorption of energy.

The particle diagram is able to illustrate that the <math alttext="delta H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the dissolution of <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is endothermic because forming new interactions between the ions and the water molecules releases energy.

The particle diagram is able to illustrate that entropy increases when <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves in water because the ions disperse in solution.

The particle diagram is able to illustrate that entropy decreases when <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves in water because many hydrogen bonds can form between the water molecules and the ions.

content.answer: The particle diagram is able to illustrate that entropy increases when <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves in water because the ions disperse in solution.
